author: F
title: graffiti NFT marketplace
description: Graffiti artists don't get compensated for their art, lack of profitability for graffiti art.

assessments.note: A marketplace for Art NFTs always brings traffic to a network. But there are already other NFT Marketplaces out there and except from the graffit Theme its hard to see the advantage of this proposal.
I really like this idea. I love that the owner of the NFT gets compensated for merchandise sales.

This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: DApps & Integrations Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can impact many people seeking to buy NFT via the Cardano DEX. This project is well executed can create a marketplace for Graffiti Artist and collectors.

Art and NFTs are a natural fit for DApps. An NFT marketplace for graffity is no exception. As the primary question of the challenge is "What applications will provide the most value for end users in 2021", I deduct one star. It feels like there are already a high number of NFT marketplaces out there. Another NFT marketplace would provide limited value to end users. Another star was reduced, because the current propsal is not about an app. It is about the creation of a website to promote the final product and digitalizing art and minting of 50 tokens. This does not provide any special value to the end-user. I deduct another star as there are no steps involved in the proposal to actually implement or even preparte the implementation of the nft marketplace.

The proposal is for creating a Steet Graffiti-based NFT market specific to a location. If a generalized NFT market catering for all art NFTs is created, it will most likely take care of this specific requirement.

Graffiti is somewhat mainstream so I see the potential to generate NFT interest. This is a unique niche among the many NFT related proposals. The impact on the Cardano ecosystem may be slow to develop but the idea has a lot of value.

The proposal targets a very small niche, a small number of street artists and street art enthusiasts in a relatively small European nation. The impact of the project on the whole Cardano ecosystem would be extremely limited as not even those involved would be necessarily directly exposed to Cardano.

The idea to create a marketplace for graffiti artworks is aligned with the main challenge objectives because it can attract a specific type of users (the one interested in this art field) to the Cardano ecosystem, allowing them to own digital copies of graffiti and support their preferred street artists.
A strong factor is the mechanism presented for a token owner to have some earning related to merchandise sale: it could create a good virtuous cycle in terms of adoptions and transactions.
The only limit that I see is that this marketplace will be limited to a niche of users. It would be great to add some metrics to explain to the general public how much this market segment is big, to better understand how many people are already involved in this sector and to better evaluate how big could be the impact of this project in term of user adoption, token created and transactions generated.

I found it an interesting idea, since the digital art market is growing and I have never seen anything related to graffiti. If people pay for "traditional" digital art, I don't see why the practice with graffiti would not work. The fact of making financial transactions using cryptocurrencies and NFT adds value to the project, which, in my view, reconciles a promising market with the practices of the Catalyst project.

So first of all the fees system seems to favor the Marketplace a lot. Then the budgetplan is kina unclear. 2k for graffiti research seems random. Especially because the artist should do the NFT and you just provide the market place.

Then there is no information about the technical stuff and how this marketplace is gonna be built. 

For the next time it would help to add more information to your proposal. The idea seems good but maybe not yet enough thought throu
Your website looks professional and gives us an idea of what we can expect from this project. Do you have connections to street artists or urban art galleries?

No technical details provided. Economics very rough and maketplace take extremely high (50-75% in the examples given?). How are you interacting with the artists? What will you do if the art was illegally placed? No evidence of technical capability provided.
It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a straightforward plan but the proposal lack details on team background and proposer.

There referenced webshop is about rental of appartments and houses. This very different to the creation of an application that uses blockchain as it backend. I admit, that there is still the purchase of a good involved in both use-cases but the webshop for the rental business looks like a off the shelf solution. Very limited development know-how is needed to implement such solution. If there is addition know-how available, it is not stated in the proposal.

The proposer has referenced the website being maintained by them. They are likely to have the expertise to implement the proposal. However, no other details regarding the team composition or their expertise are given.

The main goals are outlined and do seem feasible to a proposer with web store experience. 
Unfortunately I didn't find this proposal during the refinement stage but I think more aspects of the proposal need clarification.  For example, it seems like having a relationship with the artists should be a requirement before creating an NFT, unless you have a not for profit model. But, this fundamentally transforms the nature of illegal graffiti. For me feasibility would be a not for profit model using found, anonymous graffiti works,  with donations to relevant causes (art education for children ,etc) or a for profit model with sanctioned, legal grafitti works and  identified artists. I think more refinement is necessary.

The proposers don't seem to have experience in the field they are trying to take on. The reference they provided is for a tourism related portal that doesn't seem to have any relevance to art curation or distribution, NFTs of artist management. The proposed revenue split between the artist and the marketplace seems extremely unfair and unjustified. I would advise to gain more experience in the field and revise the business plan if reapplying in a future fund.

The main picture of the project is clear enough and the proposer presents evidences of their web development skills.
At the same time it would be great to have some more information about:
- team members and specific skills of each one
- the technologies involved for the marketplace development
- technical details about the minting process: it is clear that the proposers will do a research to identify the author, but how this information will be stored? Integrating it in the minting policy? How will be recognized the authorship from a technical point of view (you will contact the authors and ask them to create a wallet/signature and embed it in the minting policy)? Or all this information will be stored in a centralized way?
- some specifics about the marketing campaign (in what form will it be done, through what media?)
- (Not considered for rating because out of funding request): technical details about the smart contract that will be involved in the project evaluation. The main policy to split the earnings is clear but it would be great to add some specification about this topic to increase the feasibility perception for voters and CAs.
In general I really like the "editorial" approach that the proposer would like to pursue: with some more in-depth technical details I am sure that this project can receive a much higher evaluation for this criterium.

The team that proposes to develop the project is an information technology company and already has a sales website, as it was attached, aimed at the real estate market. That is, they already have the necessary basis for the development of the project, but I felt a lack of greater security in the issue of financial transactions in cryptocurrencies, because it was not clear if the team already has experience with this. Both NFT creation and ADA transactions need experienced people to function, and it is just as important a part of the project as the foundation of the website. So I think it would be beneficial to pay more attention to that part of the idea.
The proposal isn't in depth enough to do a proper assessment. The roadmap is quite short and there isn't any text about challenges and risks
Will there be only one token for each artwork? That might not generate much funds. Maybe each piece could have numbered NFTs in a run of 10 or 100.
More information of technical, economic and marketing plan required to asses feasibility.
The project plan timeframe needs more details. Think of the key performance metrics? And outline the Milestone in your project plan.
the budget is broken down into parts that can be audited pretty good. It is stated to be finalized until the end of the year. The auditing of the stated tasks should be easy to implement.

The proposal involves implementing NFT backed and creating a overlay on the existing website to georeference it. The project is relatively simple with the less technical risk, and the progress can be audited.

The funds requested seem appropriate for website, promotion, research, and creation of tokens.  It would be relatively easy to audit the success of these clear goals which should be achieved by the end of 2021. However I doubt the success of the project without a more focused approach and further refinement. If the proposers do not receive funding this round, I hope to see their proposal in a future Catalyst fund.

Even if the deliverables described in the project are completed, auditing its overall impact on the Cardano ecosystem could prove an extremely difficult task. A clear set of metrics to measure would be needed.

The general roadmap for the project is presented in a good way, but it would be nice to have some specific milestones for the stage for which fund are requested (website wireframe, website graphics, implementation, etc.).
It would also be really useful to have some KPIs (and also hard number estimate) about the users expected to be engaged with the website, with the initial token sale, the number of authors involved and also some metrics about the marketing campaign.
These indicators (related only to the part for which funds are quested) could make easier the evaluation of the success of the project. A nice add would be to provide the same metrics for the completed project (even if not part of the funds request).

The text explains several times what the idea is about and how it will happen, in addition to mentioning how the total financial amount will be divided among the parts of the project. There is also a more synthesized timeline of how the steps would take place, which helps to understand the whole thing in a more chronological way. Therefore, we know how the money will be shared and the intention of what to do, according to the time in months, so the project's applicability is very detailed and apparently safe.

solution: NFT's of digitalized graffiti artworks with smart contract compensation connected to signature if owner can verify it.
experience: IT company with a developed webshop.
